alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 11:16PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 130 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1116 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Riverside, San Bernardino, Fontana, Moreno Valley, Ontario, Corona, Rialto, Hesperia, Chino, Apple Valley, Redlands, Lake Elsinore, Yucaipa, northwestern Palm Springs, Big Bear City, Wrightwood, Lake Arrowhead, Forest Falls, I-15 Through The Cajon Pass and Mount San Gorgonio. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
